definition: to be in a bad mood
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
beginnings/clues/mental state/thread

sentences.english: But I was in a mood, so I made a joke.
sentences.chinese: 但我当时正闹情绪，所以我开了一个玩笑。

sentences.english: He's in a bad temper today.
There is no time for sentiment.
So your big plans fall through; are you going to go home and sulk?
sentences.chinese: 你的庞大计划瓦解了，你应该折返回去还是闹情绪？

sentences.english: I should not like a man who is so soon discomposed by a hot morning.
sentences.chinese: 因为上午天热就闹情绪，我才不喜欢这样的人呢。

sentences.english: I never casually mood, because I know no one will coax me.
sentences.chinese: 我从不随意闹情绪，因为深知没人会哄我。

sentences.english: Play the motions through my head, you know that I'm faking.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我在假装扮野，在动用脑子闹情绪。

sentences.english: Be careful you don't flip a switch at that restaurant or even worse do it to your server.
sentences.chinese: 不要在餐馆闹情绪，更不要冲服务员发火。

sentences.english: The best feeling is that you have to adapt to your mood.
sentences.chinese: 最好的感觉莫过于你闹情绪有人来迁就你。

sentences.english: She remained disgruntled two days later.
sentences.chinese: 两天过去了，她仍在闹情绪。
